official-title.#text:
To establish a Federal tax credit approximation matching program for State new manufacturing jobs
			 training tax credits, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

committee-name.#tail:
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

term.#tail:
means a program established by a State government that provides that, if an eligible community
			 college and an eligible manufacturing employer sign a contract that meets
			 the requirements of
term.#text: State new manufacturing jobs training tax credit program

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term

the State income taxes withheld by the employer on behalf of the eligible trainee, once employed by
			 the employer, to the extent they do not exceed the cost of qualified
			 training specified in such contract, will not be remitted to the State in
			 payment of income taxes, but will be remitted to the eligible community
			 college,

the amounts so remitted will be treated in the hands of the eligible community college as payment
			 for education provided by such community college, and

for purposes of determining the State income tax liability of the eligible trainee, the amounts so
			 remitted will be treated as if they had been remitted to the State in
			 payment of income taxes owed by the eligible trainee.
A contract meets the requirements of this paragraph if—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and an eligible manufacturing employer with at
			 least 1 job site located in such State,
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Twenty-First Century Manufacturing Skills and Jobs Act of 2014/s:2/ss:d/p:1

text.#text:
the contract is between an eligible community college located in the State that has the program
			 described in
the contract meets all applicable requirements under such State program,
the contract provides that—

the eligible community college will directly provide qualified training to individuals designated
			 by the employer or will contract with a provider of qualified training to
			 provide such training to such individuals,
the eligible community college will not charge tuition or fees to such individuals,

the employer will hire such individuals for full-time employment at a job site located within the
			 State,
such individuals will be paid by the employer a wage that is not less than the greater of—
175 percent of the Federal minimum wage, or
the amount specified under the State program, and

text.#text:
as provided under the State program, the employer will remit the State income taxes withheld by the

			 described in

the contract specifies the entire cost of the qualified training (including all costs for equipment

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: are reasonable by market standards.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Twenty-First Century Manufacturing Skills and Jobs Act of 2014/s:2/ss:d/p:2/sp:D

text.#text: the cost and terms specified under

term.#tail: means education or training which, if completed, will provide the individual with—

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term
education or skills necessary to perform the job for which such individual will be employed,

a certificate or credential which is required under Federal, State, or local governmental
			 regulation for the employment of the individual in the job for which such
			 individual will be employed, or

a certificate or credential aligned with national or regionally recognized industry standards
			 determined appropriate by the State.

is a new job (which, for purposes of this paragraph, may include a new position within an existing
			 job category), and not a job of a recalled worker, a replacement job, or
			 any other job that existed in the employer's business within the 1-year
			 period preceding the date of hire,

is not a job that existed in a business operation or substantially similar business operation of
			 the employer formerly located in another location which was closed or
			 substantially reduced by the employer, and
results in a net increase in employment for the employer.

A State program will not be treated as a State new manufacturing jobs training tax credit program
			 for purposes of this subsection unless the program provides that, in order
			 to be eligible to participate, the employer must show with respect to each
			 eligible trainee that such eligible trainee is hired for a job that—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, only employees at job sites located in the United States
			 (including the possessions of the United States) shall be taken into
			 account.
